garden_entry.text: The Manor's heavy oak doors groan as they close behind you. You stand on the threshold of the Overgrown Garden. What was once a manicured landscape is now a chaotic tangle of thorny vines, massive ferns, and trees that seem to have grown centuries in mere decades. The air is thick with the scent of wet earth and rot. A stone path, cracked and uplifted by roots, winds its way into the green gloom.

garden_path_safe.text: You move carefully along the ruined path, stepping over twisted roots. The silence here is unnaturalâ€”no birds, no insects, just the rustle of leaves in a wind you can't feel. You notice statues of weeping angels along the path, their faces eroded or... clawed off.

garden_clearing.text: You hack your way through the dense vines, emerging into a small clearing. In the center lies the skeletal remains of a large animal, its bones picked clean. A glint of metal catches your eye near the ribcage.

garden_crossroads.text: The path splits at a large, dried-up fountain. To the East, the vegetation thins out, revealing a rusted iron gate leading out of the estate. To the West, a dark thicket seems to hum with a low, vibrating sound.

choices.label: Head East towards the gate (To Village)

garden_secret.text: You defeated the Shadow Stalker guarding this place. Behind the thicket, you find a small shrine to an unknown deity. It remains untouched by the corruption of the garden.
